title: How to survive if you fall from a cruise ship
text:
Every time I step on a cruise ship with my children – which, as a travel journalist who writes about cruises, is often – I have an irrational fear that one of them will tumble overboard.

It is a split-second anxiety that dissipates almost as quickly as it surfaces, especially when I look at the reassuringly high railings on the public decks and realise how difficult it must be to accidentally fall.

But it still happens. Just last month a Royal Caribbean crew member died after falling from a ship docked in Dubrovnik, while a few days later an MSC Divina passenger was rescued after going overboard near Valencia. Back in August last year, British air hostess Kay Longstaff was pulled from the Adriatic having plunged from Norwegian Star as it sailed 60 miles off the Croatian coast. The 46-year-old said her yoga fitness and singing had helped her survive 10 hours in the water.
description: As many as 25 people topple from cruise ships each year. But what are the odds of survival and how can you increase your chances?
